Appendix 2 – Equipment, Facilities and Services of Others to be Provided — 1
Site investigations — The Client will make all relevant existing site investigations available to the Consultant. See folder: 05
Site Investigations. The client will provide updated hydrological data for use in the Production Potential. The data will be
released in October 2025. During 2025 additional site investigations have been conducted in the area. These investigations
include core drilling of seven (7) new boreholes and installation of thermistor strings, seismic surveys
in intake lake, as well as area of outfall of transfer tunnel. Mapping of depth of lakebed was also
performed in intake lake. The results of these investigations are expected to be ready for the works included in this contract.
However, the intermediate results have already resulted in relocation of the intake chamber from what
was planned in the outline proposal. The Consultant shall review the investigations and advise the Client on the extent to which they are
suŬcient for inclusion in the Employer’s Requirements for the EPC Contract, and whether further
investigations are required, see section 2.2 in appendix 1.

chunks.text:
Appendix 2 – Equipment, Facilities and Services of Others to be Provided — 2 On site oŬce facilities and logistics — The Client will pay for and arrange for on-site logistics and local transport related to necessary site
inspections during the EPC tender process. Visits to the site of the proposed hydropower station will have to be conducted by helicopter, normally
from the town of Ilulissat. The helicopter is limited to four (4) PAX (besides the pilot) for each trip. The
client will oversee chartering the needed transport for the number of visits agreed to. The consultant should include travel expenses including tickets and hotel for three (3) people in
connection with one (1) site visit EPC tender preparation and one (1) site visit for EPC Contractor
Selection. The client allows for the following time schedule for a site visit: Two (2) travel days for a return trip to
Ilulissat and one (1) day for a site visit with helicopter. Under the option of construction supervision, the Client will make available basic oŬce and
accommodation on site for the persons preforming the services described.

Appendix 2 – Equipment, Facilities and Services of Others to be Provided — 3 Information exchange and digital platforms — NunaGreen will provide a Microsoft SharePoint platform for data storage and exchange during design
and tender preparation. The Consultant is expected to use this platform for the services included in
this contract. NunaGreen will provide a Dalux Tender platform for the EPC Pre-Qualiﬁcation and Tender.
